Baseball Drills Hitting and Fielding Drills for All Age Groups Preface This book is a practical guide for baseball/ softball coaches and players who want a single reference for skill development. Each chapter organizes drills by skill area and includes descriptions, key teaching points, and video examples. Use this book as: A practice design tool — pick drills based on your focus for the day. A reference guide — find specific drills for mechanics or strategy. A training progression — follow chapters in order to build complete fundamentals. Equipment & Safety Notes Before starting any drill: Inspect equipment for safety and wear. Make sure throwing and hitting zones are clear. Emphasize proper warm-up routines and stretching before drills. Encourage hydration and recovery time. Warm-up Recommendation Begin each practice with: Dynamic warm-up (5–8 minutes) — jog, lunges, arm circles, mobility. Throwing progression (10 minutes) — short toss to long toss. Skill warm-up (5 minutes) — short, focused fundamental drill. Some Websites MC Minor Baseball Rule Books here.
